text.p: Lisbon underground railway company Metropolitano de Lisboa has ordered 54 carriages from a consortium including Adtranz Portugal and Siemens in a deal worth 15.5 billion escudos, the consortium said.
Adtranz is a joint venture between Daimler-Benz and ABB.
The first carriage will be delivered in July 1998 and the order should be completed in April 1999, a statement said.
The latest order complements a March 1995 order from Metropolitana de Lisboa for 114 carriages from the consortium.
Adtranz Portugal, a unit of Adtranz, is responsible for 60 percent of the new order and Siemens the remaining 40 percent.
